Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Grounds_for_Claim: Well-founded fear of persecution based on religion
Evidence_Requirement: Evidence of religious persecution, including destruction of house churches and inconsistent enforcement of registration rules
Institutional_Action: Remitted for re-determination by a different panel
Evidence_Type: Country condition reports, applicant testimony, documentation of church closures
Nature_of_Participation: Non-state actor resistance to state regulation of religious practice
Personal_Data_Implicated: Religious belief, membership in underground Christian churches
Complaint_Issues: Underestimation of risk due to focus on lack of arrest warrants and church size
Protected_Group: Christians, particularly unregistered house church members
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution under IRPA
Protection_Claim: Need for international protection due to state persecution
State_Protection_Assessment: Inadequate state protection for unregistered religious groups
Risk_Factor: Destruction of house churches, arbitrary enforcement of registration laws
Credibility: Not explicitly challenged; evidence deemed sufficient by court
State_Protection_Adequacy: Found inadequate due to active suppression of unregistered religious activities
Risk_Nature: Persecution for practicing religion outside state-sanctioned channels
Enforcement_Action: Destruction of house churches, harassment of members
